text: Thank you, will see how we can do this, we are starting our first real HubSpot cms site for this client, so lots of exploring to do.
If there are any other questions we can help to answer for you, please let us know.

Hello,  Im a 100% noob to HubSpot, and wonder which channel is best to ask my 100% noob questions on.  I am only going to be working on the CMS side of things.  (as a developer and would like to learn to make a simple site) Thanks before for any help.

Hey Jason we have many different channels in here that questions can go in. If you are ever unsure, you can always post them here in <#C22PU4LV8|general> or <#CD432DF3K|new-to-HubSpot-cms> and we can point you to the right channels if needed.

For starting building on HS, I would suggest reviewing our developer docs here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms> if you have questions after reviewing those, feel free to ask away :slightly_smiling_face:
Improvement + no notification is 200x better than no improvement at all
<@U2H3TT8F2> - Hi, AJ.  It notes that you are the owner of this slack instance on your profile.  Any insight regarding my issue above?
Hey John, I would try reaching out to our support directly on this issue. You can also try our <#C2YHAHB6K|api> channel to see if folks in that channel may be able to help you out as well.

Does anyone have any ideas how I can limit the daily enrollment of contacts in a workflow - the use case is this: throttle initial workflow enrollment to run a manual A/B test of the performance for each workflow branch, and then release update the workflow so only the winning "branch" executes. My functional goal is that if I have 5000 contacts who qualify to enter the workflow, I can only enter the first 500, while the remaining 4500 are somehow put on "hold". Any ideas?
